name: Step-ups
how_to_perform:
1. Choose a sturdy staircase, bench, or step.
2. Stand in front of the step with your right foot on the ground and your left foot on the step.
3. Keep your back straight, abs engaged, and your chest out as you lift your right foot onto the step.
4. Step up fully and bring both feet onto the step, ensuring that your weight is evenly distributed between both legs.
5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
6. Slowly lower yourself by stepping down with one foot (either foot, alternate with each repetition) until your starting position is reached.
7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions on each leg.
short_summary: Step-ups are a lower body exercise that primarily target the quadriceps, glutes, and calves.
alternative_names: Box jumps (if explosive jumping motion is used)
